relation: you can always register for memberships of different clubs and you get to experience different activities:)
Plan ahead before registering to your classes, make sure you get in touch with a counselor to make sure you are in a right path.
Skyline College faculty are very helpful. It is a diverse community college, so you meet a lot of friends. The classes offered are great and a great start for someone transferring to a university.
pageTitle: Skyline College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18801=skyline is affordable and a great deal for your money, and has tons of financial aid in the beginning of the semester. scholarships are available for applications in february, don't miss out., 24688=for fun i have joined the trio club and found it pretty much cool. i am getting assisted from trio counselors + i have the opportunity to apply for $1000 scholarship which is wonderful., 18281=puente, kabbabayan, astep: these respectively hispanic, phillipino and african american groups have no racial criteria for joining, some come and taste some other cultures. you can get a scholarship for $1000 a year by doing so., 153918=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 29260=What students do for fun on campus is create events that will be entertaining for everybody. For example the lyricist events that we have allows students in the music major to come out and express their feelings through lyrics. We also have monthly heritage month. For example this month, February, is National African American Heritage month., 16884=only outsiders with problems have ever given skyline problems, it's been safe as a warm snuggie since 2005., 60458=I was part of the EOPS and TRIO which helped me pay for my books, graduation gown and give out many grants from $500-$1000}

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot i am leanring alot about myself at skyline beacuse it gives me the chance to get to know myself and what type of course i can handle and i also teaches me how to be indepent.i learned how to transition from a high schol student to a productive college student who does not waste her time in class.
